14#pragma once
15
16#include <inttypes.h>
17
18#include <isc/assertions.h>
19#include <isc/atomic.h>
20#include <isc/error.h>
21#include <isc/lang.h>
22#include <isc/mutex.h>
23#include <isc/platform.h>
24#include <isc/types.h>
25
26/*! \file isc/refcount.h
27 * \brief Implements a locked reference counter.
28 *
29 * These macros uses C11(-like) atomic functions to implement reference
30 * counting. The isc_refcount_t type must not be accessed directly.
31 */
32
33ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
34
35typedef atomic_uint_fast32_t isc_refcount_t;
36
37/** \def isc_refcount_init(ref, n)
38 * \brief Initialize the reference counter.
39 * \param[in] ref pointer to reference counter.
40 * \param[in] n an initial number of references.
41 * \return nothing.
42 *
43 * \warning No memory barrier are being imposed here.
44 */
45#define isc_refcount_init(target, value) \
46 atomic_init(target, value)
47
48/** \def isc_refcount_current(ref)
49 * \brief Returns current number of references.
50 * \param[in] ref pointer to reference counter.
51 * \returns current value of reference counter.
52 *
53 * Undo implict promotion to 64 bits in our Windows implementation of
54 * atomic_load_explicit() by casting to uint_fast32_t.
55 */
56
57#define isc_refcount_current(target) \
58 (uint_fast32_t)atomic_load_explicit(target, memory_order_acquire)
59
60/** \def isc_refcount_destroy(ref)
61 * \brief a destructor that makes sure that all references were cleared.
62 * \param[in] ref pointer to reference counter.
63 * \returns nothing.
64 */
65#define isc_refcount_destroy(target) \
66 ISC_REQUIRE(isc_refcount_current(target) == 0)
67
68/** \def isc_refcount_increment0(ref)
69 * \brief increases reference counter by 1.
70 * \param[in] ref pointer to reference counter.
71 * \returns previous value of reference counter.
72 */
73#define isc_refcount_increment0(target) \
74 isc_refcount_increment(target)
75
76/** \def isc_refcount_increment(ref)
77 * \brief increases reference counter by 1.
78 * \param[in] ref pointer to reference counter.
79 * \returns previous value of reference counter.
80 */
81#define isc_refcount_increment(target) \
82 atomic_fetch_add_explicit(target, 1, memory_order_relaxed)
83
84/** \def isc_refcount_decrement(ref)
85 * \brief decreases reference counter by 1.
86 * \param[in] ref pointer to reference counter.
87 * \returns previous value of reference counter.
88 */
89#define isc_refcount_decrement(target) \
90 atomic_fetch_sub_explicit(target, 1, memory_order_release)
91
92ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
93
